00017  *              in the top level directory
00018  * description: All MAC designed for use with UWB-IR should derive from this
00019  *        class. It provides the necessary functions to build UWBIR
00020  *        packets and to receive them.
00021  ***************************************************************************/

00023 // See the following publications for more information:
00024 // [1] An Ultra Wideband Impulse Radio PHY Layer Model for Network Simulation,
00025 // J. Rousselot, J.-D. Decotignie, Simulation: Transactions of the Society
00026 // for Computer Simulation, 2010 (submitted).
00027 // [2] A High-Precision Ultra Wideband Impulse Radio Physical Layer Model
00028 // for Network Simulation, Jérôme Rousselot, Jean-Dominique Decotignie,

00030 // http://portal.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1537714

00033 #ifndef UWBIRMAC_H
00034 #define UWBIRMAC_H
00035 
00036 #include "MiXiMDefs.h"
00037 #include "BaseMacLayer.h"
00038 #include "IEEE802154A.h"
00039 #include "Packet.h"
00040 
00041 class MacToPhyInterface;
00042 class UWBIRMacPkt;
00043 
00054 class MIXIM_API UWBIRMac : public BaseMacLayer {
00055 private:
00058   UWBIRMac(const UWBIRMac&);
00061   UWBIRMac& operator=(const UWBIRMac&);
00062 
00063 public:
00064 
00065     virtual void initialize(int stage);
00066 
00067     virtual void finish();
00068 
00069     UWBIRMac()
00070       : BaseMacLayer()
00071       , debug(false)
00072       , stats(false)
00073     , trace(false)
00074     , rsDecoder(false)
00075     , packetsAlwaysValid(false)
00076     , totalRxBits(0), errRxBits(0)
00077       , phy(NULL)
00078       , packet(100)
00079       , prf(0)
00080       , packetsBER()
00081       , dataLengths()
00082     , erroneousSymbols()
00083     , sentPulses()
00084     , receivedPulses()
00085     , meanPacketBER()
00086     , packetSuccessRate()
00087     , packetSuccessRateNoRS()
00088     , ber()
00089     , meanBER()
00090     , RSErrorRate()
00091     , success(), successNoRS()
00092     , nbReceivedPacketsNoRS(0), nbReceivedPacketsRS(0), nbSentPackets(0), nbSymbolErrors(0)
00093     , nbSymbolsReceived(0), nbHandledRxPackets(0), nbFramesDropped(0)
00094     { }
00095 
00096 protected:
00097     bool debug;
00098     bool stats;
00099     bool trace;
00100     bool rsDecoder;
00101     bool packetsAlwaysValid;
00102     double totalRxBits, errRxBits; // double and not long as we divide one by the other to get the BER
00103     MacToPhyInterface* phy;
00104     Packet packet;
00105     int prf; // pulse repetition frequency
00106     cOutVector packetsBER;
00107     cOutVector dataLengths;
00108     cOutVector erroneousSymbols;
00109     cOutVector sentPulses;
00110     cOutVector receivedPulses;
00111     cOutVector meanPacketBER;
00112     cOutVector packetSuccessRate;
00113     cOutVector packetSuccessRateNoRS;
00114     cOutVector ber;
00115     cStdDev meanBER;
00116     cOutVector RSErrorRate;
00117     cOutVector success, successNoRS;
00118 
00119     long nbReceivedPacketsNoRS, nbReceivedPacketsRS;
00120     long nbSentPackets;
00121     long nbSymbolErrors, nbSymbolsReceived;
00122     long nbHandledRxPackets;
00123     long nbFramesDropped;
00124 
00125     // warning: cfg value is currently ignored
00126     void prepareData(UWBIRMacPkt* packet, IEEE802154A::config cfg = IEEE802154A::cfg_mandatory_4M);
00127 
00128     void handleLowerMsg(cPacket *msg);
00129 
00130     bool validatePacket(UWBIRMacPkt * mac);
00131 
00132     void initCounters();
00133 
00134 };
